title: Authors and Citation
text: Allen OBrien. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: OBrien (2023). pangoRo: R toolset work PANGO lineages. R package version 0.2.4, https://github.com/al-obrien/pangoRo, https://al-obrien.github.io/pangoRo/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pangoRo: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages},   author = {Allen OBrien},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.4, https://github.com/al-obrien/pangoRo},   url = {https://al-obrien.github.io/pangoRo/}, }

what: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages
title: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages
text: COVID-19 lineage names can confusing navigate; many aliases want catch examine , helps additional tools… {pangoRo} R package support interacting PANGO lineage information. core functionality inspired similar package called pango_aliaser created Cornelius Roemer Python language.

title: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages
text: can install {pangoRo} GitHub:
code: remotes::install_github('al-obrien/pangoRo')

title: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages
text: basic usage {pangoRo} expand, collapse, sort COVID-19 lineages. Start creating pangoro object links latest (cached) PANGO reference. passed subsequent operations reference.
code: library(pangoRo)  # Create pangoro object my_pangoro <- pangoro() #> Loading alias table from PANGO webiste...

title: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages
text: vector PANGO lineages, provide fully collapsed output. Can also define far collapse input.
code: # Vector of COVID-19 lineages to collapse cov_lin <- c('B.1.617.2', 'BL.2', 'B.1.1.529.2.75.1.2', 'BA.2.75.1.2', 'XD.1')  # Collapse lineage names as far as possible collapse_pangoro(my_pangoro, cov_lin) #> [1] "B.1.617.2" "BL.2"      "BL.2"      "BL.2"      "XD.1" collapse_pangoro(my_pangoro, cov_lin, max_level = 1) #> [1] "B.1.617.2"   "BL.2"        "BA.2.75.1.2" "BL.2"        "XD.1"

title: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages
code: # Vector of COVID-19 lineages to expand cov_lin <- c('B.1.617.2', 'B.1.617.2.6', 'AY.4', 'AY.39', 'BL.2', 'BA.1', 'AY.2', 'XD.1')  # Expand lineage names as far as possible exp_lin <- expand_pangoro(my_pangoro, cov_lin) exp_lin #>            B.1.617.2          B.1.617.2.6                 AY.4  #>          "B.1.617.2"        "B.1.617.2.6"        "B.1.617.2.4"  #>                AY.39                 BL.2                 BA.1  #>       "B.1.617.2.39" "B.1.1.529.2.75.1.2"        "B.1.1.529.1"  #>                 AY.2                 XD.1  #>        "B.1.617.2.2"               "XD.1"

title: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages
text: Perform pseudo-sort lineage names. Split lineages lowest alias codes sort within grouping
code: # Sort lineages sort_pangoro(my_pangoro, exp_lin) #>                 BA.1                 BL.2            B.1.617.2  #>        "B.1.1.529.1" "B.1.1.529.2.75.1.2"          "B.1.617.2"  #>                 AY.2                 AY.4          B.1.617.2.6  #>        "B.1.617.2.2"        "B.1.617.2.4"        "B.1.617.2.6"  #>                AY.39                 XD.1  #>       "B.1.617.2.39"               "XD.1" collapsed_full <- collapse_pangoro(my_pangoro, cov_lin, aliase_parent = TRUE)  grps <-  split(collapsed_full, sapply(strsplit(collapsed_full, split = '\\.'), `[[`, 1)) lapply(grps, function(x) sort_pangoro(my_pangoro, x)) #> $AY #> [1] "AY"    "AY.2"  "AY.4"  "AY.6"  "AY.39" #>  #> $BA #> [1] "BA.1" #>  #> $BL #> [1] "BL.2" #>  #> $XD #> [1] "XD.1"

title: R toolset to work with PANGO lineages
text: Although initial recombinant variants typically obvious based upon X prefix, children may (e.g. EG.1).
code: is_recombinant(my_pangoro,                c('EG.1', 'EC.1', 'BA.1', 'XBB.1.9.1.1.5.1', 'B.1.529.1')) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE

title: Collapse PANGO lineage names — collapse_pangoro
text: Collapse provided PANGO lineage names completely maximum depth. Recombinant variants collapsed. NA_character values carried .

title: Collapse PANGO lineage names — collapse_pangoro
code: collapse_pangoro(   pangoro,   input,   max_level = NULL,   simplify = TRUE,   aliase_parent = FALSE )

title: Collapse PANGO lineage names — collapse_pangoro
text: pangoro Pangoro object. input Vector lineage names collapse (character vector). max_level far expand lineage name (default: maximum). simplify Boolean, pass mapply. aliase_parent Boolean, use alias code originating parent (e.g. BQ.1.10.1 -> EC)

title: Collapse PANGO lineage names — collapse_pangoro
code: if (FALSE) { my_pangoro <- pangoro() x <- c('B.1.1.529.1', 'B.1.1.529.2.75.1.2', 'BA.1', NA_character_) collapse_pangoro(my_pangoro, x) collapse_pangoro(my_pangoro, x, 1) collapse_pangoro(my_pangoro, x, 2) }

title: Expand lineage from alias — expand_pangoro
text: Expand lineage names alias parent name maximum step. Recombinant variants expanded. NA_character values carried .

title: Expand lineage from alias — expand_pangoro
code: expand_pangoro(pangoro, input = character(), max_level = NULL, simplify = TRUE)

title: Expand lineage from alias — expand_pangoro
text: pangoro Pangoro object. input Vector lineage names expand (character vector). max_level far expand lineage name (default: maximum). simplify Boolean, pass mapply

title: Expand lineage from alias — expand_pangoro
text: Although several string splits occur, function can expand 1e6 values <2 minutes.

title: Expand lineage from alias — expand_pangoro
code: if (FALSE) { my_pangoro <- pangoro() expand_pangoro(my_pangoro, c('BA.1', 'BA.1.2.3', 'BL.2')) expand_pangoro(my_pangoro, c('BA.1', 'BA.1.2.3', 'BL.2'), 1) expand_pangoro(my_pangoro, c('BA.1', 'BA.1.2.3', 'BL.2'), 2) expand_pangoro(my_pangoro, c('BA.1', 'BA.1.2.3', 'BL.2'), 200) # Only goes as far as it can }

what: Fetch alias table from PANGO — fetch_pango_alias
title: Fetch alias table from PANGO — fetch_pango_alias
text: Pulls JSON formats flat table. Recombinants determined number lineages associated alias. subsequent children aliases flagged.

title: Fetch alias table from PANGO — fetch_pango_alias
code: fetch_pango_alias(   url =     "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/cov-lineages/pango-designation/master/pango_designation/alias_key.json" )

title: Fetch alias table from PANGO — fetch_pango_alias
text: url Character value defining raw data location alias table.

title: Fetch alias table from PANGO — fetch_pango_alias
code: if (FALSE) { fetch_pango_alias() }

what: Fetch full summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_full_tbl
title: Fetch full summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_full_tbl
text: Pulls lineage notes data PANGO designation GitHub: https://github.com/cov-lineages/lineages-website/blob/master/_data/lineage_data.full.json?raw=true. Compared fetch_pango_summary_tbl, function pulls entire set summary information available PANGO JSON file. provide full lineage name, *Description* column searched alias information based upon regular expression passed pattern parameter. parameter set NULL, alias search ignored full_name column excluded.

title: Fetch full summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_full_tbl
code: fetch_pango_full_tbl(   url =     "https://github.com/cov-lineages/lineages-website/blob/master/_data/lineage_data.full.json?raw=true",   pattern = "^([Aa]lias of)\\s?([A-Z\\.\\d]*)[,]?\\s?.*$",   description_col = "Description" )

title: Fetch full summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_full_tbl
text: url Character value defining location JSON file containing complete summary details PANGOLIN. pattern Regular expression search description column alias details. description_col Name description column (default: 'Description').

title: Fetch full summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_full_tbl
code: if (FALSE) { fetch_pango_full_tbl() fetch_pango_full_tbl(pattern = NULL) }

title: Fetch PANGO lineage notes — fetch_pango_notes
text: Pulls lineage notes data PANGO designation GitHub: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/cov-lineages/pango-designation. provide full lineage name, *Description* column searched alias information based upon regular expression passed pattern parameter. parameter set NULL, alias search ignored full_name column excluded.

title: Fetch PANGO lineage notes — fetch_pango_notes
code: fetch_pango_notes(   url =     "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/cov-lineages/pango-designation/master/lineage_notes.txt",   pattern = "^([Aa]lias of)\\s?([A-Z\\.\\d]*)[,]?\\s?.*$",   description_col = "Description" )

title: Fetch PANGO lineage notes — fetch_pango_notes
text: url Character value defining location lineage notes PANGOLIN. pattern Regular expression search description column alias details. description_col Name description column (default: 'Description').

title: Fetch PANGO lineage notes — fetch_pango_notes
code: if (FALSE) { fetch_pango_notes() fetch_pango_notes(pattern = NULL) }

what: Fetch summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_summary_tbl
title: Fetch summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_summary_tbl
text: Pulls available COVID-19 lineage website: https://cov-lineages.org/lineage_list.html. recent changes late 2022, website annual subset lineages. Since table embedded within web-page rvest package used read HTML content. provide full lineage name, *Description* column searched Alias information based upon regular expression passed pattern parameter. parameter set NULL, alias search ignored full_name column excluded.

title: Fetch summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_summary_tbl
code: fetch_pango_summary_tbl(   url = "https://cov-lineages.org/lineage_list.html",   pattern = "^([Aa]lias of)\\s?([A-Z\\.\\d]*)[,]?\\s?.*$",   description_col = "Description",   slice = 1,   ... )

title: Fetch summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_summary_tbl
text: url Character value defining location summary table PANGOLIN. pattern Regular expression search description column alias details. description_col Name description column (default: 'Description'). slice Integer value (default: 1), controls table page extract. ... Additional parameters send read_html.

title: Fetch summary table from PANGO. — fetch_pango_summary_tbl
code: if (FALSE) { fetch_pango_summary_tbl() }

title: Detect recombinants — is_recombinant
text: Determine input lineages expand back recombinant node.

title: Detect recombinants — is_recombinant
code: is_recombinant(pangoro, input, use_names = FALSE)

title: Detect recombinants — is_recombinant
text: pangoro Pangoro object. input Vector lineage names expand (character vector). use_names Boolean determine logical character value recombinant names used.

title: Detect recombinants — is_recombinant
text: Either boolean character vector

title: Detect recombinants — is_recombinant
code: if (FALSE) { my_pangoro <- pangoRo::pangoro() is_recombinant(my_pangoro, c('EG.1', 'EC.1')) }

what: List parents of provided alias — list_parents
title: List parents of provided alias — list_parents
text: Provide lineage return vector parent aliases. vectorized.

title: List parents of provided alias — list_parents
code: list_parents(pangoro, input)

title: List parents of provided alias — list_parents
text: pangoro Pangoro S3 class object. input Lineage name (scalar).

title: List parents of provided alias — list_parents
code: if (FALSE) { my_pangoro <- pangoro() list_parents(my_pangoro, 'BL.1') lapply(c('BL.1', 'BA.1', 'BE.9.1', 'BQ.4', 'XBA.1'), list_parents, pangoro = my_pangoro) }

title: Create pangoro object — pangoro
text: Create S3 class object contain necessary PANGO alias details working functions (expanding collapsing names). cache PANGO lineage table current R session.

title: Create pangoro object — pangoro
code: pangoro(   path =     "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/cov-lineages/pango-designation/master/pango_designation/alias_key.json",   refresh = FALSE,   offline = FALSE,   rm_spec_char = TRUE )

title: Create pangoro object — pangoro
text: path Path PANGO lineage JSON file. refresh Boolean value force cache refresh (default: FALSE) offline Boolean value, TRUE use saved version alias table within package. rm_spec_char Boolean (default: TRUE)

title: Create pangoro object — pangoro
code: if (FALSE) { my_pangoro <- pangoro() # First time will fetch from web my_pangoro <- pangoro() # Second time will fetch from cache my_pangoro <- pangoro(refresh = TRUE) # Force cache to refresh }

title: Print pangoRo object — print.pangoro
text: Print alias lineage table pangoRo object.

title: Print pangoRo object — print.pangoro
code: # S3 method for pangoro print(x, ...)

title: Print pangoRo object — print.pangoro
text: x pangoRo object. ... used.

what: Search for alias within PANGO lineages — search_pangoro
title: Search for alias within PANGO lineages — search_pangoro
text: Search alias within PANGO lineages

title: Search for alias within PANGO lineages — search_pangoro
code: search_pangoro(pangoro, input, search, direction = "both")

title: Search for alias within PANGO lineages — search_pangoro
text: pangoro Pangoro S3 class object. input Lineage name (scalar). search Alias name search related input list. direction Search parents () /children () alias (default: ).

title: Search for alias within PANGO lineages — search_pangoro
code: if (FALSE) { my_pangoro <- pangoro() search_pangoro(my_pangoro, 'BA.5', 'BA.5.1') mapply(c('BA.5', 'BA.5'),c('BA.5.1', 'BL.1'), FUN = function(x,y) {search_pangoro(my_pangoro,x,y)}) }

title: Sort PANGO lineages — sort_pangoro
text: Return ordering PANGO lineages based upon provided list names may include aliases.

title: Sort PANGO lineages — sort_pangoro
code: sort_pangoro(pangoro, x, index_only = FALSE, na.last = FALSE, ...)

title: Sort PANGO lineages — sort_pangoro
text: pangoro Pangoro class object x Vector pango lineages index_only Boolean value, return index sorted values (default: FALSE). na.last Sort NAs top bottom (default: TRUE, sort top) ... Additional parameters order.

title: Sort PANGO lineages — sort_pangoro
code: if (FALSE) { my_pangoro <- pangoro() x <- c('BL.2', 'BA.1', 'BA.1.2.3', 'BA.1.223.3', 'BA.1.4.3','BL.2', 'BA.1') sort_pangoro(my_pangoro, x) sort_pangoro(my_pangoro, x, index_only = TRUE) sort_pangoro(my_pangoro, x, na.last = TRUE) sort(x) # Compare to normal sort in base R }

title: Summarize pangoRo object — summary.pangoro
text: Supply basic summary details pangoRo object.

title: Summarize pangoRo object — summary.pangoro
code: # S3 method for pangoro summary(object, ...)

title: Summarize pangoRo object — summary.pangoro
text: object pangoRo object. ... used.

title: pangoRo 0.2.4 (2023-11-08)
text: Add is_recombinant() helper function Fix bug collapsing inputs already partially collapsed Add feature collapse parents can forced use alias (e.g. BQ.1.10 -> EC), can useful specific use-cases (e.g. grouped sorting)

title: pangoRo 0.2.3 (2023-08-21)
text: Update local alias table

title: pangoRo 0.2.2 (2023-02-12)
text: Add tests

title: pangoRo 0.2.1 (2023-02-12)
text: Missing imports added Parameter checks Update local alias table

title: pangoRo 0.2.0 (2023-02-11)
text: First main release GitHub Add search_pangoro() function
